title: Support IPFS special remote
body:
I've been playing around a bit with [git-annex's IPFS special remote][annex-ipfs].  The special remote implementation is documented as experimental and from 2015, but it still seems to work as advertised.

```
$ git annex whereis one
whereis one (1 copy) 
  	97de50fe-d40e-45e6-bd29-6c307ed4971b -- [ipfs]

  ipfs: ipfs:QmUB9Nr7RpqNYQpyh4W9r3RQNttiPQ6BQ9iQLkw9LztJFz
ok
$ git annex get one
get one (from ipfs...) 
Saving file(s) to .git/annex/tmp/SHA256E-s4--2c8b08da5ce60398e1f19af0e5dccc744df274b826abe585eaba68c525434806
 4 B / 4 B [================================================================] 100.00% 0s
(checksum...) ok
(recording state in git...)
```

But if I try to `datalad get` the a file from IPFS, DataLad doesn't think anything needs to be done.

```
$ git annex drop --force one
drop one ok
(recording state in git...)
$ datalad -f json_pp get one
{
  "action": "get",
  "path": "/tmp/gx-ipfs-HZmC5Wq/one",
  "status": "notneeded",
  "type": "file"
}
$ git annex whereis one
whereis one (1 copy)
  	97de50fe-d40e-45e6-bd29-6c307ed4971b -- [ipfs]

  ipfs: ipfs:QmUB9Nr7RpqNYQpyh4W9r3RQNttiPQ6BQ9iQLkw9LztJFz
ok
```

I think IPFS is a pretty neat option for people that want to share public data without setting up external hosting somewhere, so it'd be great to make DataLad work with the IPFS special remote.

[annex-ipfs]: https://git-annex.branchable.com/special_remotes/ipfs/
